Atlanta.Plaza Theatre (Atlanta):
The Plaza Theatre is an Atlanta landmark and the city’s longest continuously operating movie theatre.[1]


== History ==


=== 1939 - 2000 ===
Designed by architect George Harwell Bond, the Plaza Theatre opened on December 23, 1939, as an art deco cinema and live theater space. It was the neighborhood cinema for the Druid Hills, Virginia Highland and Poncey-Highland neighborhoods of Atlanta. It is an anchor of the Briarcliff Plaza on Ponce de Leon Avenue, Atlanta's first shopping center with off-street parking.
